uk.co.saiman.comms

Interface Comms

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SerialPort

    public interface Comms
    Some sort of comms interface which can be opened as a byte channel.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Comms.CommsStatus
      A description of the status of a comms channel.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDescriptiveName() 
      Optional<CommsException> getFault() 
      CommsChannel openChannel()
      Open a byte channel over the comms interface.
      default CommsStream openStream() 
      CommsStream openStream(int packetSize) 
      void reset()
      Kill any open streams of channels and reset the comms system to it's basic disconnected state, attempting to clear any faults in the process.
      CommsException setFault(CommsException fault)
      Indicate that the comms object is in a fault state.
      uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.ObservableValue<Comms.CommsStatus> status() 

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptiveName

        String getDescriptiveName()
        Returns:
        a human readable name for the channel, where available

      • status

        uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.ObservableValue<Comms.CommsStatus> status()
        Returns:
        the current status of the channel

      • reset

        void reset()
        Kill any open streams of channels and reset the comms system to it's basic disconnected state, attempting to clear any faults in the process.

      • setFault

        CommsException setFault(CommsException fault)
        Indicate that the comms object is in a fault state.
        Parameters:
        fault - the new fault state
        Returns:
        the given fault state

      • getFault

        Optional<CommsException> getFault()
        Returns:
        if the comms object is in a fault state an optional containing the cause of the fault, otherwise an empty optional

      • openChannel

        CommsChannel openChannel()
        Open a byte channel over the comms interface. The caller is responsible for closing the channel, and has exclusive access to it until this time. Successive invocations will fail until the previously returned channel is closed.
        Returns:
        the opened byte channel

      • openStream

        default CommsStream openStream()

      • openStream

        CommsStream openStream(int packetSize)
